articles.headline: Rule to Expand Mountaintop Coal Mining
articles.snippet: The Bush administration is set to issue a regulation to enshrine a method of blasting off the tops of mountains.
articles.abstract: The Bush administration is set to issue a regulation to enshrine a method of blasting off the tops of mountains.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 — The Bush administration is set to issue a regulation on Friday that would enshrine the coal mining practice of mountaintop removal. The technique involves blasting off the tops of mountains and dumping the rubble into valleys and streams.

articles.headline: Militias Seizing Control of Iraqi Electricity Grid
articles.snippet: Armed groups increasingly control the switching stations that channel electricity around Iraq, an official said.
articles.abstract: Armed groups increasingly control the switching stations that channel electricity around Iraq, an official said.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Aug. 22 — Armed groups increasingly control the antiquated switching stations that channel electricity around Iraq, the electricity minister said Wednesday.
articles.byline: By James Glanz and Stephen Farrell

articles.headline: Homemade Shortcuts for the PC
articles.snippet: David Pogue explores the time-saving qualities of macro software.
articles.abstract: David Pogue explores the time-saving qualities of macro software.
articles.lead_paragraph: Are you ready for a shock? According to a study from the Sloan School of Management at M.I.T., computers actually make you less productive. By the time you’ve finished stumbling around your software and fiddling with your formatting, you’ve spent more time than you would have had you just typed the thing on a typewriter.

articles.headline: Video Chats Aren’t Just for Tycoons
articles.snippet: With Web conferencing, you can make a call home seem like a news update.
articles.abstract: With Web conferencing, you can make a call home seem like a news update.
articles.lead_paragraph: A few years ago, the phone was the only quick way to get in touch with distant relatives. Their voices were all you got, so it didn’t matter if Grandpa was still in his bathrobe and slippers.

articles.headline: Assurances on Buybacks May Cost a Lender
articles.snippet: Countrywide Home Loans may not be able to meet its promise to investors of repurchasing loans if necessary.
articles.abstract: Countrywide Home Loans may not be able to meet its promise to investors of repurchasing loans if necessary.
articles.lead_paragraph: Expanding rapidly as the nation’s largest home mortgage company, Countrywide Home Loans quietly promised investors who bought its loans that it would repurchase some if homeowners got into financial difficulties.

articles.headline: Lehman Closes Subprime Unit and Lays Off 1,200
articles.snippet: The decision to close BNC Mortgage made it the latest casualty in the subprime mortgage meltdown that started earlier this year.
articles.abstract: The decision to close BNC Mortgage made it the latest casualty in the subprime mortgage meltdown that started earlier this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lehman Brothers, a leader in packaging subprime mortgages into securities, said yesterday that it would shut one of its home lending units and lay off 1,200 employees. The bank said it would take a $52 million charge to third-quarter earnings.
articles.byline: By Jenny Anderson and Vikas Bajaj

articles.headline: Gambling Dispute With a Tiny Country Puts U.S. in a Bind
articles.snippet: A trade dispute filed by Antigua and Barbuda, a Caribbean nation with dozens of online casinos, challenges Washington’s effort to prohibit online gambling.
